biography: Emma Anderson (born 10 June 1967, Raynes Park, Wimbledon, London) is an English musician known as the songwriter, guitarist and secondary vocalist with the bands Lush and Sing-Sing, and earlier the bass player in a band called The Rover Girls. In 1993, she also contributed to Drum Club's _Everything Is Now_ album. She is not to be confused with a Swedish pop singer named Emma Andersson. Please fix your tags if necessary! Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
name: Emma Anderson

lastfm.bio_content: Emma Anderson (born 10 June 1967, Raynes Park, Wimbledon, London) is an English musician known as the songwriter, guitarist and secondary vocalist with the bands Lush and Sing-Sing, and earlier the bass player in a band called The Rover Girls. In 1993, she also contributed to Drum Club's _Everything Is Now_ album. She is not to be confused with a Swedish pop singer named Emma Andersson. Please fix your tags if necessary! Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
